poem:
In Honor

Lifting him  
from the weight   
of memory  
into the light—  
her hands, full  
of his music,  
scatter seeds  
of kindness,  
silent guitars  
strumming  
a future.  
In the wake  
of their laughter,  
green shoots  
promise  
where his name  
has sung.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Malcolm-Jamal Warner’s widow launches philanthropic organizations in his honor The widow of actor and singer Malcolm-Jamal Warner has announced the launch of two philanthropic organizations in his honor, paying tribute to her late husband in social media posts that identified her for the first time. On Friday, the day before the eighth anniversary of their wedding, Tenisha Warner published a photo on Instagram of her and her Grammy-winning husband holding hands and laughing together on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
